channel.title: Frolian's blog
channel.description: standing on the shoulders of PyGiants

item.title: Finite-Difference Stencil Derivation using Sympy
item.description: Since the topic came up in a MOOC I'm currently taking, this post focuses on a (the?) general method for deriving high-order approximations to derivatives of functions sampled on a grid.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Converting PDF Scans for Optimized Reading on a Kindle 3: a Case-Study
item.description: I'm still clinging to my Kindle 3 ("Keyboard") ebook reader. I often want to read PDF files that are scanned copies of old books. Since performance easily suffers when using the files as is, I've researched ways to convert the files to a more suitable PDF format.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: What would Maxwell plot? (a replication with matplotlib)
item.description: Inspired by a tweet, we follow a rabbit hole down the matplotlib path. We end up recreating a figure originally published by Maxwell regarding electrostatics.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Building a Panel app for our Cook my Meat clone
item.description: As a follow-up to our previous post, we present a simple interactive app built with recent Python dashboarding technology called Panel.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Solving the Heat Equation like in Harvard's Cook my Meat App
item.description: In the latest installment of posts about science in the kitchen, we solve the heat equation using the Crank-Nicolson scheme and apply it to the cooking of meat, following Harvard's Cook my Meat app.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Participating and Finishing Advent of Code 2019 (a.k.a. Intcode Odyssey)
item.description: In this post, I reflect on the 2019 Advent of Code journey and how it felt to finish it.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Using the World Air Quality Index API to make pollution maps
item.description: Using the World Air Quality Index API, we explore some of the possibilities and end up making a pollution map of Europe using GeoViews.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Building an Eiffel Tower made of Springs
item.description: As a bonus for thinking about spring models, this blog post triangulates the Eiffel tower and then makes it wiggle.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Optimal Control of a Spring System
item.description: In this follow-up post to yesterday's spring dynamics, I try to replicate a numerical experiment mentioned in the DiffTaichi paper. The experiment is to adjust the physical parameters of a three spring system iteratively to reach a certain goal.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Springs Mechanics
item.description: One of the simplest models you can use in physics is a spring. This notebook examines and animates a couple of simple spring physic models.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A Short Tutorial on Cepstral Analysis for Pitch-tracking
item.description: Since I'm developing a pitch-tracking application, I'm writing a little tutorial on how to use cepstral processing for f0 estimation.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Brewdog Beers Statistics
item.description: We scrape the data from the Brewdog beer catalog to determine what an average beer looks like in terms of mash temperature, mash time and fermentation temperature.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Testing the human random number generator algorithm
item.description: In this short article, we examine if the algorithm for random number generation with human input proposed by another blogger works as advertised.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Solving the tensioned string equation in time domain and frequency domain
item.description: In this blog post, we will look at the tensioned string equation and solve it using two different mathematical methods, both widely used in the industry: a time-domain finite differences as well as a frequency-domain modal solution.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Scripting Anki using its API to list Japanese kanji
item.description: In this blog post, I use the Anki API to script my Anki flashcards database and extract a list of Japanese vocabulary words associated to the kanji I have learned.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Anki and the MOOC Fundamentals of waves and vibrations
item.description: I recently finished a MOOC called Fundamentals of waves and vibrations, from Ecole Polytechnique. It was the first time I combined a MOOC with Anki, a well-known flashcard applications. In this post, I'll try to say what I liked about this experience, as well as about the course.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Harmonic Waves, Standing Waves and Group Velocity
item.description: In this post, we examine standing waves as well as propagation in dispersive media using harmonic waves.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Monopoles, dipoles and quadrupole animations
item.description: In this post, we animate well known sound sources: monopole, dipole and quadrupole.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Un générateur de mot de passe dans le style d'XKCD
item.description: Un petit outil de génération de mot de passe inspiré d'XKCD et adapté à la langue française.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Plotting the World Oil Reserves
item.description: In this blog post, we're using data from Wikipedia to reason about the world oil reserves. We then apply the Hubbert model to predict world oil dynamics (in a very unaccurate way!).
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Ray Lens Interactions in Optics
item.description: Since I'm now learning photography, I've been reading and researching optics foundations. In this post, I'll do a bit of computations and ray tracing for a spherical lens.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Preparing for the 2018 Google Hashcode (the Pizza problem)
item.description: In this blog post, we tackle the training problem for the 2018 Hashcode programming competition, which is about cutting pizza. We implement a solution using a greedy algorithm and optimize it to run fast using Pythran.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Ray Tracing with Numpy and Autograd
item.description: Following a recent tweet, this blog post investigates the use of autograd for the ray tracing problem in the context of numerical computing with Numpy.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Participation au hackathon 2017 de la BNF
item.description: J'ai eu la chance de participer au 2ème hackathon organisé par la BNF le 25 et 26 novembre 2017. Petit retour sur cette belle expérience.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Fun with the Ulam Spiral
item.description: Following an Advent of Code, we're examing the Ulam spiral and its implementation and end up with some nice GIFs.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Testing the Durand-Kerner Method on a Degree 3 Polynomial
item.description: In this post, we apply the Durand-Kerner method to a degree 3 polynomial and plot the resulting "trajectory".
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Cooking an Egg using Math
item.description: In this short Friday science blog post, we're cooking an egg using a special "Mathy" method and running a little advertisement for the Harvard cooking and physics MOOC.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Paris Appartment Prices: Scrape and Plot!
item.description: Since I'm looking for a new appartment these days, what better project than to scrape a website with a lot of appartment data and plot some maps?
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A Convolutional Neural Network for Face Keypoint Detection
item.description: A recent article on Medium prompted me to investigate how difficult it is to train a convolutional neural network for face keypoint detection. Spoiler alert: it's not too difficult!
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Un flux RSS pour le podcast Sur les épaules de Darwin
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous créons un flux RSS pour l'émission Sur les épaules de Darwin, basé sur le site de Clément Grimal.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Un flux RSS pour le podcast Rendez-vous avec X
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous construisons un flux RSS pour le podcast archivé de l'émission Rendez-vous avec X.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Annotating a Vocal Folds YouTube Video with a Spectrogram using Moviepy
item.description: Since taking singing classes, I've been fascinated by how singing works. One key component to that is the vocal tract with its well known vocal folds. To better visualize what the vocal folds are doing, we will start with a YouTube video that shows them in action and superimpose a well known visualization known as a spectrogram using matplotlib and moviepy.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Le jeu des bâtonnets de Fort Boyard
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous nous intéressons au jeu des bâtonnets de Fort Boyard et proposons une solution en Python.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Optimizing a Function with Cython, Complex Numbers and Parallel Execution
item.description: In this post, we're doing practical optimization using Cython and speeding up a function for parallel execution involving C++, complex numbers and exponentials.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Optimizing your code with NumPy, Cython, pythran and numba
item.description: This post sums up what I learned in the last three days in a training about Python optimization. We'll review the use of NumPy, Cython, pythran and numba applied to the case of the computation of a Laplacian edge detection operator and benchmark the generated codes.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Les résultats du deuxième tour de l'élection législative 2017 : description et modélisation
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous téléchargeons les données du ministère de l'intérieur à l'issue du second tour des élections législatives 2017 et comparons trois modèles probabilistes simples pour vérifier notre intuition sur les reports de vote des électeurs.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Les résultats du premier tour de l'élection législative 2017
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous téléchargeons les données du ministère de l'intérieur à l'issue du premier tour des élections législatives 2017 et proposons un modèle probabiliste simple pour prédir les résultats du second tour.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Three Visualizations of Chaos
item.description: In this blog post, we take a graphical look at three examples from Chaos theory, wonderfully introduced in James Gleick's book: the logistic map, Newton's method in the complex plane and the Lorenz differential equation system.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Des cartes du second tour de l'élection présidentielle 2017
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous utilisons les données du ministère de l'intérieur pour cartographier les résultats du second tour de l'élection présidentielle 2017.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Des cartes du premier tour de l'élection présidentielle 2017
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous combinons les données du ministère de l'intérieur avec les contours des départements pour cartographier les résultats du premier tour de l'élection présidentielle 2017.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Understanding the Karplus-Strong with Python (Synthetic Guitar Sounds Included)
item.description: In this notebook, I present the Karplus-Strong algorithm and show how it can be applied to synthetize realistic guitar sounds using Python.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Solving the Harmonic Oscillator Equations
item.description: In this notebook, we solve the harmonic oscillator problem using three different methods: sympy, our own finite difference solution and scipy's integrated ODE solving tools.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Une application Android pour s'informer sur les programmes électoraux 2017
item.description: Les programmes des candidats pour la présidentielle 2017 sont complexes. Pour les explorer, je propose une application Android sous forme de quizz.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Summing Complex Exponentials: a Classical Visualization
item.description: This post is all about the geometrical interpretation of Fourier transforms in the complex plane.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: 33C3 talks
item.description: This blog entry lists some of the talks that were held at the 33C3 conference in Hamburg, Germany, in December 2016.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Fixing My Nexus 5 Power Button Issue
item.description: In this post, I'm explaining how I managed to fix my Nexus 5 phone power button problems by resoldering a new one on it.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Finishing Reason and Persuasion, a Coursera MOOC about Plato
item.description: This post summarizes my impressions after taking the Coursera MOOC "Reason and Persuasion: Thinking Through Three Dialogues By Plato" by John Holbo (University of Singapore).
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Replicating the Talk Statistics for Hackers
item.description: This post focuses on replicating the data from Jake VanderPlas' slides "Statistics for hackers".
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Do People Attend Emergency Rooms Less During Sports Events?
item.description: In this post, we examine statistical data from a journal article about emergency room attendance and try to replicate its conclusions using elementary statistical testing.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Moral Dilemmas in Batman Begins (2005)
item.description: This blog post is devoted to Batman Begins (2005) and its numerous moral dilemmas. We use moviepy to produce short, annotated movie clips showcasing some of the interesting situations from the movie.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Removing the Background from an Image using scikit-image
item.description: Triggered by a thread on StackOverflow, we try to remove the background of a sample image using scikit-image.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Applying the Watershed Transform to a Cuneiform Tablet
item.description: In this blog post, we're applying the watershed transform to a cuneiform tablet using scikit-image.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Making Your Own Autostereograms using Python
item.description: In this post, we'll learn how to make our own autostereograms using two methods: shifted images and tiled random dot patterns.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: 2016, une crue de la Seine exceptionnelle ?
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous examinons la question suivante : "la crue de la Seine de juin 2016 peut-elle être considérée comme exceptionnelle au vu des données historiques disponibles sur le sujet ?".
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Measuring the Complexity of an Algorithm
item.description: In this post, we discuss how to measure the complexity of an algorithm using three implementations of the Fibonacci sequence.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Using Bokeh to Map Internet Usage and GDP over Time
item.description: In this post, I'm using Bokeh to visualize world bank data about GDP and internet usage as a function of time.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Why Python is Missing a Built-in Argmax Function
item.description: In this post we discuss the fact that Python is missing a built-in argmax function and how it's actually there, but hidden within an optional argument to max!
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Simulating a 1D Wave on a String Using Finite Differences
item.description: In this notebook, I use code by Hans-Petter Langtangen to simulate a vibrating string using 1d finite differences. I then animate the simulation results and show some interesting vibration phenomenon in the frequency domain.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Understanding Branch Cuts in the Complex Plane
item.description: When doing complex analysis, you can encounter so-called branch cuts. We explore this topic with the example of the square root function and show how to put the branch cut in different locations of the complex plane.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A 0D Model of Rice Cooker Cooking
item.description: Following a previous experimental post on rice cookers, we explore a simple model that allows the prediction of the temperature measurements performed above the rice cooker.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Mapping a Disk to a Square
item.description: This post is an excuse for a little geometric exploration related to squares and circles and how they map on each other.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Rice Cooker Temperature Measurements Using Arduino and Python
item.description: In this blog post, I'll describe how I setup an Arduino to measure the temperature in my rice cooker during cooking and Python to analyze the data.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A Probabilistic Model for Ingredients in the Kaggle What's Cooking Challenge
item.description: As a follow up to the Kaggle What's Cooking challenge, we're proposing a probabilistic method based on naive baives classification to suggest better ingredient features.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: At What Age Do Musicians Die? (feat. Pandas & Bokeh)
item.description: In this post, we smooth data by Ramiro Gomez and display it using bokeh.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Les députés français et l'absentéisme aux scrutins de l'assemblée nationale : analyse par député
item.description: Suite au précédent billet, je me penche ici sur des données détaillées issues du site de l'assemblée nationale. En particulier : qui est absent ? Y a-t-il des députés qui votent souvent ?
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Les députés français et l'absentéisme aux scrutins de l'assemblée nationale
item.description: Ce billet me donne l'occasion d'une nouvelle exploration sur la présence (ou plutôt l'absence) des députés français, en moyenne, aux scrutins de l'assemblée nationale.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Thoughts Before Attemping Hashcode 2016
item.description: Just a day before the qualification round of 2016's hashcode, some thoughts about this programming competition.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Visualizing the Vélib Stations in Paris using pandas and bokeh
item.description: In this post, we will use an open dataset from the Vélib (Paris shared bicycle system) provider and do data visualization using pandas and bokeh.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Charged Particle Trajectories in Electric and Magnetic Fields
item.description: In plasma physics, charged particles are subject to magnetic and electric fields. In this notebook, we investigate their trajectories in special cases of these fields.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Looking at Matter from Two Scales
item.description: In this notebook, we look at matter from two point of views: a local description and a global point of view. It turns out that the average vision is different from the local vision. Like in plasma physics.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Visualization the Kaggle What's Cooking recipes using Bokeh and QQ plots
item.description: Another look at the Kaggle What's Cooking dataset, from the visualization side. This time, we'll use Bokeh for interactive visualization of QQ plots.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Roman Emperors of the West: Plots of their Rise and Fall
item.description: In this post, we set out to reproduce a plot by Randy Olson, using Wikipedia data about the Roman emperors before the fall of the empire. We then propose a new visualization of the reign durations that shows stability and turmoil in the Roman empire from a different perspective.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A tutorial about drawing Sankey graphics using matplotlib
item.description: This post is a little tutorial about the Sankey diagram capabilities of matplotlib. We'll start by drawing simple Sankey boxes, connecting them and as a final project we will build a graphics showing how hard MOOCs are.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: L'âge moyen des sénateurs français
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous calculons l'âge du sénateur français moyen à partir des données disponibles sur le site du sénat. Contrairement au billet de la semaine dernière sur les députés, nous allons directement récupérer ces informations à l'aide de requêtes web. Nous utilisons ensuite des données de l'INSEE pour évaluer la représentation des différentes classes d'âge françaises par les députés.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: 2015, Year of the MOOC?
item.description: In this post, I reflect upon the MOOCs that I have taken in 2015. Lessons learned, what it means for me.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The Kaggle What's Cooking challenge
item.description: In this post, we go through the basics of training a logistic regression on the Kaggle What's Cooking data. We also do some in-depth analysis on recipes and their ingredients.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: L'âge moyen des députés français
item.description: Dans ce billet, nous calculons l'âge du député français moyen à partir des données disponibles sur le site de l'assemblée nationale. Nous utilisons ensuite des données de l'INSEE pour évaluer la représentation des différentes classes d'âge françaises par les députés.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: L'algorithme du radoteur
item.description: Dans ce post, nous nous intéressons à l'algorithme du radoteur, inventé par Roland Moreno et proposons une implémentation de cet algorithme en Python.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Autodeploying this blog with Travis
item.description: In this post, I explain how I got Travis-CI to work with this blog.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: On the use of windows in digital signal processing
item.description: Ever wondered what happens when you window a signal before computing a FFT? Hamming, boxcar, Blackman anyone? In this post, we're looking at all these windows from a fresh point of view and detail some of their applications to signal analysis.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: How do balls bounce?
item.description: In this notebook, we'll go to the bottom of a thought that occured to me during a recent Lindy Hop class.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Installing sms-tools under Mac OS X and Anaconda
item.description: This post is dedicated to installing the sms-tools software suite using a virtual environment made with Anaconda under Mac OS X.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Building a PyQt application to record your microphone and plot its spectrum
item.description: In this post, in explain how to build a PyQt application that to record input from your microphone and plots it in real time, including the associated spectrum, using PyAudio, matplotlib and numpy.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Implementing the k-means algorithm with numpy
item.description: In this post, we examine a pure numpy implementation of the k-means algorithm and animate its convergence on an example dataset.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The Farthest Neighbors Algorithm
item.description: In this notebook, we take a look at the farthest neighbors algorithm, in the fashion of Peter Norvig.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Exploring Japanese characters with principal component analysis
item.description: What if you apply a machine learning technique such as principal component analysis to the mysterious Japanese characters? Will it reveal their secret structure or just make for a fancy blogpost?
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The topology of Paris as seen by my alarm clock
item.description: In this post, we will use a little geography to determine the topology of Paris as seen from the point of view of my alarm clock.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Animating an ancient Japanese wave pattern
item.description: In this post, we delve into graphical art based on an ancient Japanese wave pattern.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A quantitative analysis of XKCD comic #314
item.description: Do you know XKCD? Have you ever wondered if comic #314 was actually accurate? In this post, I’ll present my analysis of this comic and show that it is indeed possible to obtain dating pool curves similar to the ones shown in the comic using Census Bureau data.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Smile Recognition Using OpenCV and scikit-learn
item.description: In this post, we’re using a little of machine learning, some IPython notebook interaction and OpenCV to determine if a face found in the webcam’s frame is smiling or not.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A 3D model of the Paris area using the Google elevation API and OpenSCAD
item.description: In this post we use the elevation API provided by Google to obtain some height information about the Paris area and build a 3D model from the data using the OpenSCAD language. The result can be brought to the physical world using a 3D printer.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Building graphs with Japanese vocabulary and kanji
item.description: This post visualizes the relationship between kanji and vocabulary data from my Japanese language learning deck using graphs.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The seven modes of Tetris
item.description: You'll never listen to Tetris in the same way again after hearing our seven church modes rendition with a Game Boy and a bowl sound.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Variations on the Samsung whistle ringtone
item.description: What would you do in Korea where everyone uses the same Samsung ringtone on their smartphone if you wanted to stand out and be original? I say: butcher it, chop it to pieces and make a nice new sound out of it.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: How to create a Game Boy sound in Python?
item.description: We examine hardware specs of the old school Game Boy and find ourselves enjoying 8 bit music with Python.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A little fun with stacking bricks
item.description: A fun summer project in which we learn how to stack bricks Jenga style.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Modelling the game of poker
item.description: Being in Las Vegas, it's difficult to think about poker and not ask yourself "How does it really work? What are the odds of winning with a given hand?". Therefore, this post is devoted to an attempt at implementing a poker simulation.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Generating a gallery of clothes while using interactive IPython notebook tools
item.description: This post is dedicated to a small clothing experiment. With the help of Google, I've downloaded images of pants and t-shirts (or shirts) from the internet. Using Python and matplotlib, I will generate and display random pairings from these images.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Exploring Finnish words using the interactive IPython HTML widgets
item.description: In this post, we're gonna take a look at the Finnish language. Our starting point is a file which contains the 10000 most common words found in Finnish.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A Wave Reflecting On A Boundary
item.description: In this post, we animate the exact solution of a scalar wave reflecting at a boundary.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The Mandelbrot fractal
item.description: The Mandelbrot fractal is a well known mathematical object, foremost for its beauty. In this post, we're going to explore how to draw it, with the help of a couple of Python commands.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Implementing the 2048 game
item.description: Let's try to implement the 2048 game in Python!
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Trajectories in the French department landscape
item.description: In this post, I present a visualization I use when trying to memorize cell phone numbers: the French "département" trajectory landscape.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: The Fourier series of a rectangle function
item.description: Do you know the Fourier transform? In this post, we plot the Fourier transform of the rectangle function.
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Analyzing verb endings in the Japanese language
item.description:
Goal of this study¶

According to Tae Kim's guide to Japanese grammar and its introduction to Japanese verbs, the following holds true:

All ru-verbs end in 「る」 while u-verbs can end in a number of u-vowel sounds including 「る」. Therefore, if a verb does not end in 「る」, it will …
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Creating a shortcut to the IPython Notebook server in the Windows 7 file explorer
item.description:
These days I tend to use the IPython Notebook with pretty much every computational project that I use. At work, I'm using Windows 7. By default, it is quite cumbersome to launch an IPython Notebook in Windows 7. The steps are as follows:

  • Navigate to the directory I want to …
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: Japan life tables
item.description: I recently watched this Vice video on Youtube which is a coverage about the Japanese sex industry. Except for the fact that it looks like it was made with a message in mind that ressembles "the Japanese are weird", it cited government surveys about the population of Japan declining. Given …
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais

item.title: A response to falling with helium (Wolfram blog DIY)
item.description:
I'm following the explanations from this blog post: http://blog.wolfram.com/2013/10/08/a-response-to-falling-with-helium/.

The central question to answer is:

how long it would be necessary for someone to fall in order to jump out of an airplane, fill a large balloon with helium while falling, and land …
item.dc:creator: Florian Le Bourdais
